Religious fervour begins as continues celebrate the Bonalu festival
The city of Hyderabad was all set for the Bonalu festivities conducted here, on Sunday. Every year, lakhs of devotees congregate to pay obeisance to Mahankali. This year celebrations began in the early hours of the day with special pujas at all major temples as devotees thronged to offer ‘bonam’.
Bonalu, a Hindu festival is celebrated to worship Goddess Mahakali and is celebrated across the city. This festival is conducted as thanksgiving to the Goddess for fulfillment of vows. It is celebrated in the month of Aashaadam (July/August). The festivities began by celebrating the first Sunday of ‘Aashaadam’ at the temple at Golconda Fort. On the second Sunday, at Ujjaini Mahakali Temple in Secunderabad and Balkampet Yellamma temple in Balkampet, and on the third Sunday, at the pochamma and katta maisamma temple of chilkalguda and the Matheswari temple of Lal Darwaza in Old City of Hyderabad.
Commenting on this occasion, Mr. Hari Krishna, Director of Culture, Govt. of Telangana said “It is heartwarming to see the city celebrating its rich festival with so much enthusiasm. With thousands of devotees this year, attired in their best offering Bonalu, it was worth witnessing the colourful procession“.
Celebrating this festival for more than 150 years, Bonalu is an annual festival of Telangana where Goddess Mahankali or Kali is worshipped to ward off evil and usher peace.
